intro: Pastoraea abulensis, commonly known as the Abulensis false heath, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, leathery leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
